intro: Chaetocarpus castanicarpus var. genuinus, commonly known as the red-flowered sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cariophyllaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and distinctive, spiny leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with pink to red petals, which bloom in summer. It thrives in coastal environments, preferring sandy or gravelly soils and full sun exposure. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and its ability to withstand saline and windy conditions.
